reference_preview: Welcome to the Adaptive AI Podcast, I'm your host, Ryan Thompson, and today we're exploring the fascinating topic of de-extinction – bringing back the Woolly Mammoth. Ryan Thompson: I'm Ryan Thompson, and this is the Adaptive AI Podcast, where we dive into the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, and today we're taking a step back in time to talk about reviving one of history's most iconic creatures. Ryan Thompson: Joining me is Dr. Helena Vasquez, a renowned geneticist and expert in the field of de-extinction. Dr. Vasquez, welcome to the show. Thank you, Ryan, it's great to be here. Let's dive right in – what inspired you to pursue the de-extinction of the Woolly Mammoth? The Woolly Mammoth's genetic material has been preserved in permafrost for thousands of years, providing a unique opportunity to study and learn from its biology. By bringing back the Mammoth, we can gain insights into the evolution of its traits and potentially apply that knowledge to
